function.arguments:
{"message": "
I have successfully addressed all code review comments for PR #100. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

## Issues Fixed:

1. **Backend Performance Optimization**: 
   - Fixed redundant network call in `update_feed_url` function
   - Replaced `fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)` with direct `process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)` to avoid duplicate feed fetching
   - This was identified by Gemini Code Assist as an unnecessary performance issue

2. **Frontend API Configuration**: 
   - Updated `API_BASE_URL` to use relative paths (`/api`) instead of hardcoded port 5001, making it production-ready

3. **Frontend Error Handling**: 
   - Fixed syntax error in `handleEditFeedSubmit` function
   - Improved user experience in the edit modal

## Verification:
- All 74 tests are passing (1 skipped as expected)
- Changes have been committed and pushed to the `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed` branch
- Documentation updated in `CHANGELOG.md` and `TODO.md`

## Next Steps:
The feature branch `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed` now contains all the fixes requested in the code review. The changes include:
  - Performance optimization in the backend
  - Production-ready API configuration
  - Improved error handling and user experience

The code review cycle for PR #100 is now complete with all review comments addressed.
"}
function.name: finish

   - Replaced `fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)` with direct `process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)` to avoid duplicate feed fetching
   - This was identified by Gemini Code Assist as an unnecessary performance issue

2. **Frontend API Configuration**:

3. **Frontend Error Handling**:

## Verification:

microagent_knowledge.name: github
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITHUB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitHub API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITHUB_TOKEN` to interact with GitHub's API.
ALWAYS use the GitHub API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_pr` tool to open a pull request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitHub (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://${GITHUB_TOKEN}@github.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_pr` tool to create a pull request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a pull request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a pull request, send the user a short message with a link to the pull request.
* Do NOT mark a pull request as ready to review unless the user explicitly says so
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

microagent_knowledge.name: gitlab
microagent_knowledge.content:
You have access to an environment variable, `GITLAB_TOKEN`, which allows you to interact with
the GitLab API.

<IMPORTANT>
You can use `curl` with the `GITLAB_TOKEN` to interact with GitLab's API.
ALWAYS use the GitLab API for operations instead of a web browser.
ALWAYS use the `create_mr` tool to open a merge request
</IMPORTANT>

If you encounter authentication issues when pushing to GitLab (such as password prompts or permission errors), the old token may have expired. In such case, update the remote URL to include the current token: `git remote set-url origin https://oauth2:${GITLAB_TOKEN}@gitlab.com/username/repo.git`

Here are some instructions for pushing, but ONLY do this if the user asks you to:
* NEVER push directly to the `main` or `master` branch
* Git config (username and email) is pre-set. Do not modify.
* You may already be on a branch starting with `openhands-workspace`. Create a new branch with a better name before pushing.
* Use the `create_mr` tool to create a merge request, if you haven't already
* Once you've created your own branch or a merge request, continue to update it. Do NOT create a new one unless you are explicitly asked to. Update the PR title and description as necessary, but don't change the branch name.
* Use the main branch as the base branch, unless the user requests otherwise
* After opening or updating a merge request, send the user a short message with a link to the merge request.
* Do all of the above in as few steps as possible. E.g. you could push changes with one step by running the following bash commands:
```bash
git remote -v && git branch # to find the current org, repo and branch
git checkout -b create-widget && git add . && git commit -m "Create widget" && git push -u origin create-widget
```

- Frontend API configuration fixed for production deployment
- Error handling UX improved with proper syntax and user feedback

This addresses the feedback from the previous PR #100 review cycle.

arguments.title: fix: Address all Gemini Code Assist review comments for PR #100
arguments.body:
## Summary
This PR addresses all code review comments from Gemini Code Assist for the "Feat/editable feed urls fixed" feature.

## Changes Made

### Backend Performance Optimization
- Fixed performance issue in `update_feed_url` function by replacing redundant `fetch_and_update_feed` call with direct `process_feed_entries` to avoid duplicate network requests

### Frontend Configuration
- Updated API configuration to use relative paths for production deployment instead of hardcoded port 5001

### Frontend Error Handling
- Fixed syntax error in `handleEditFeedSubmit` function
- Improved user experience in edit modal with proper error handling

### Testing
- Updated test to match optimized implementation
- All tests passing (74 passed, 1 skipped)

## Technical Details
- Backend: Modified `update_feed_url` to use `process_feed_entries` directly instead of calling `fetch_and_update_feed` again
- Frontend: Updated API_BASE_URL configuration for production compatibility
- Documentation: Updated CHANGELOG.md and TODO.md

## Verification
- All three identified code review issues resolved
- Backend performance optimized by eliminating redundant network calls
- Frontend API configuration fixed for production deployment
- Error handling UX improved with proper syntax and user feedback

This addresses the feedback from the previous PR #100 review cycle.

{"message": "
I have successfully addressed all code review comments from Gemini Code Assist for PR #100. Here's what was accomplished:

## ✅ Code Review Issues Resolved:

1. **Backend Performance Optimization**
   - Fixed the redundant `fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)` call in the `update_feed_url` function
- Replaced with direct `process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)` to avoid duplicate network requests
- This improves efficiency by reusing already fetched feed data

2. **Frontend API Configuration**
   - Updated `API_BASE_URL` to use relative paths (`/api/`) instead of hardcoded port 5001
- Ensures compatibility with production deployment environments

3. **Frontend Error Handling**
   - Fixed syntax error in `handleEditFeedSubmit` function
- Improved user experience in the edit modal with proper error handling

3. **Testing Updates**
   - Modified `test_update_feed_url_success` to match the optimized implementation

## 📊 Results:
- All tests passing: 74 passed, 1 skipped
- Documentation updated: CHANGELOG.md and TODO.md
- Changes committed and pushed to the `feat/editable-feed-urls-fixed` branch

## 🔗 New PR Created:
A new pull request has been opened at: https://github.com/sheepdestroyer/SheepVibes/pull/103

The code review cycle has been completed successfully. The feature "Feat/editable feed urls fixed" is now ready for review with all performance optimizations and configuration fixes applied.
"}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:

## ✅ Code Review Issues Resolved:

1. **Backend Performance Optimization**
   - Fixed the redundant `fetch_and_update_feed(feed.id)` call in the `update_feed_url` function
- Replaced with direct `process_feed_entries(feed, parsed_feed)` to avoid duplicate network requests
- This improves efficiency by reusing already fetched feed data

2. **Frontend API Configuration**
   - Updated `API_BASE_URL` to use relative paths (`/api/`) instead of hardcoded port 5001
- Ensures compatibility with production deployment environments

3. **Frontend Error Handling**
   - Fixed syntax error in `handleEditFeedSubmit` function
- Improved user experience in the edit modal with proper error handling

3. **Testing Updates**
